intro: Sirmuellera quercifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf sirmuellera, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves that resemble those of oak trees, giving it its common name. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Sirmuellera quercifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests.
